Class: Composite

sprites/composite. Composite

new Composite(sn, x, y, id, endCallback)

Construct a composite sprite. Do not call this constructor directly; you should instead call sn.createComposite() on the engine.

A composite is a collection of sprites that can be manipulated as one. They share the same plane which means they are more efficient. A composite has x, y, but no h position, but the sprites within it behave as though they have x and h but no y position (y is ignored within a composite).

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
sn Object The engine reference
x Number X position in the world for the composite.
y Number Y position in the world for the composite.
id String A unique identifier.
endCallback Function <optional>
 Once the composite and all its child sprites expire, this is called.

Methods

addSprite(defName, stateName, x, y, h, opts)

Add a sprite to the composite.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
defName The name of the sprite definition to use. These are set up in your game's spriteDefs data.
stateName The initial state. This too is defined in the sprite's definition, in your game's spriteDefs data.
x Number The world x coordinate. If a function, it should take no parameters and return a number.
y Number The world y coordinate. If a function, it should take no parameters and return a number.
h Number The height off the ground. If a function, it should take no parameters and return a number.
opts Object <optional>
 For a list of parameters see the opts parameter on the Sprite class constructor.

isActive(now) → {Boolean}

Tests to see if this is an active composite. Inactive composites will be destroyed by the engine. If any child sprites are active, this will be active.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
now Number Current frame timestamp
Returns:
True if active
Type
Boolean
